BR_text.BRsummary: Crash when using Horovod with Torch0.4 and Py3
BR_text.BRdescription:
There's a segfault which shows up in test_torch.py/test_broadcast_state when running tests (i.e. pytest -v).
 If this test is run separately (i.e. pytest -v test/test_torch.py ), then it passes.
 Commit used to build Horovod: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/horovod/horovod/commit/4cf885f8807413720024543f853ff3af06413770>4cf885f</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-link:https://pastebin.com/raw/xGzwu6jr>Crash message</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-link:https://pastebin.com/raw/iifPG6tS>Stacktrace from corefile</denchmark-link>

I don't understand the error mentioned in the message below but any chance this is relevant? Since pytest is doing tensorflow tests before pytorch...
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/uber/horovod/blob/4cf885f8807413720024543f853ff3af06413770/test/test_1st.py#L16>https://github.com/uber/horovod/blob/4cf885f8807413720024543f853ff3af06413770/test/test_1st.py#L16</denchmark-link>

comments_3.comment_text:
I flipped the tests around. Ran pytorch first then keras. This time it crashed at Keras
 test/test_keras.py::KerasTests::test_load_model_broadcast Segmentation fault (core dumped)

comments_4.comment_text:
I re-ran tests as follows, and see this error:
 <denchmark-code># mpirun -allow-run-as-root -np 2 -H localhost:2 -bind-to none -map-by slot -mca mpi_abort_print_stack 1 pytest -v --capture=no
 ...
 test_torch.py::TorchTests::test_broadcast_state test_torch.py::TorchTests::test_broadcast_state [2018-12-28 03:20:08.204140: I /tmp/pip-req-build-0unu076w/horovod/common/operations.cc:1668]
 test_torch.py::TorchTests::test_broadcast_state terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::ios_base::failure[abi:cxx11]'
   what():  basic_ios::clear: iostream error
 </denchmark-code>
 
 It corresponds to , so looks related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/horovod/horovod/pull/671>#671</denchmark-link>
 .

comments_5.comment_text: Did you run the tests with master too? This looks like a different error. Looking into it
